result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Ulysses Shaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Ulysses Shaver is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Ulysses Shaver was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court suspends and waives Court costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from PO as Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward. gme
c: Def, DA, NRPD & Jail. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jason Ulysses Shaver appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:57 p.m.  There is an agreement.  Attorney Kucinski recites the agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2.  DE makes statement.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

DE sentenced to 7 days in the St. Croix County Jail credit for 7 days served.
- Court suspends and waives all court costs
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Steve Dunlap for EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Jason Ulysses Shaver appeared from jail.  Atty Kucinski states this was to be a plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Filed by N. Lebrecht. Re: status of Def. km

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Jason Ulysses Shaver appeared from jail. Atty Kucinski does not think Defendant should be charged, ADA Kelly requests Motion to be in writing. Defendant is unable to post the bond. Defendant's Minister has a place for him to stay and he would like to be released to take care of the Pierce County warrant. Bond continues in form and amount.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
